flags.name: fix
flags.description: Attempt to automatically fix validation issues

flags.name: dry-run
flags.description: Show what would be fixed without applying changes (requires --fix)

flags.name: divergence
flags.description: Validate branch hasn't diverged from main

flags.name: leases
flags.description: Validate active leases are consistent and not stale

export.description: Archive a complete snapshot of issues and documents

flags.name: at
flags.description: Git commit/tag to export (requires git repository)

flags.name: working-tree
flags.description: Export from working tree instead of git

flags.name: committed-only
flags.description: Reject if uncommitted docs/assets exist (requires git, implies --at HEAD)

flags.name: json
flags.description: Output metadata as JSON instead of human-readable format

init.description: Initialize the issue tracker in the current directory

flags.name: hierarchy-template
flags.description: Hierarchy template to use (default, extended, agile, minimal)

query.description: Query events by type or issue

create.description: Create custom preset from issue gates

args.name: from_issue
args.description: Issue ID to copy gates from

add.description: Add a gate requirement to an issue

args.name: gate_keys
args.description: Gate key(s) from registry (e.g., 'tests', 'code-review', 'clippy') Can specify multiple: jit gate add <issue> gate1 gate2 gate3

check.description: Check a single gate for an issue (run automated checker)

define.description: Define a new gate in the registry

flags.name: description
flags.description: Description of what this gate checks

flags.name: checker-command
flags.description: Command to execute for automated gates

flags.name: timeout
flags.description: Timeout in seconds for checker command

flags.name: working-dir
flags.description: Working directory for checker (relative to repo root)

remove.description: Remove a gate definition from the registry

check-all.description: Check all automated gates for an issue

list.description: List all git worktrees with JIT status

install.description: Install git hooks for lease and divergence validation

flags.name: glob
flags.description: Search only in specific files (glob pattern, e.g., "*.json" or "*.md")

validate.description: Validate configuration files for errors and warnings

flags.name: global
flags.description: Set in user config instead of repository config

show.description: Show effective configuration from all sources

add.description: Add a gate definition to the registry

flags.name: at
flags.description: View document at specific commit (defaults to HEAD)

flags.name: rescan
flags.description: Rescan document to refresh asset metadata

add.description: Add a document reference to an issue

args.name: path
args.description: Path to document relative to repository root

flags.name: commit
flags.description: Git commit hash (optional, defaults to HEAD)

flags.name: skip-scan
flags.description: Skip scanning document for assets (default: false)

history.description: List commit history for a document

remove.description: Remove a document reference from an issue

archive.description: Archive a document with its assets

flags.name: type
flags.description: Archive category (must be configured in config.toml)

flags.name: force
flags.description: Override safety checks (allow archival of docs linked to active issues)

list.description: List document references for an issue

check-links.description: Check document links and assets for validity

values.description: List all values used in a namespace

args.name: query
args.description: Search query (searches title, description, and ID)

flags.name: full
flags.description: Return full issue objects instead of minimal summaries

Asset.description: Asset reference discovered in a document

content_hash.description: SHA256 hash of file content (if file exists)

is_shared.description: Whether this asset is shared across multiple documents

mime_type.description: MIME type based on file extension

original_path.description: Original path as written in the document

resolved_path.description: Resolved absolute path from repository root

oneOf.description: Local file asset (relative or root-relative path)
File not found at resolved path

DocumentReference.description:
A reference to a document (design doc, notes, artifact) in the repository

Documents can reference files at HEAD or specific git commits for version-aware knowledge management.

assets.description: Assets referenced by this document (images, diagrams, etc.)

commit.description: Optional git commit hash (None = HEAD, Some("a1b2c3d") = specific commit)

GateState.description: State of a quality gate for a specific issue

updated_at.description: When the gate was last updated

oneOf.description: Created but not actionable yet (blocked by dependencies or gates)
All dependencies done and gates passed, ready for work
Work complete, awaiting quality gate approval

success_schema.description: An issue representing a unit of work

context.description: Flexible key-value storage for agent-specific data

created_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp when issue was created

dependencies.description: IDs of issues that must be done first

documents.description: References to design documents, notes, and artifacts

gates_required.description: Gate keys that must pass before ready/done

gates_status.description: Current status of each required gate

updated_at.description: RFC 3339 timestamp when issue was last updated

success_schema.title: Issue

update.description: Update an issue or multiple issues

args.name: id
args.description: Issue ID (for single issue mode, mutually exclusive with --filter)

flags.name: filter
flags.description: Boolean query filter (for batch mode, mutually exclusive with ID)

flags.name: add-gate
flags.description: Add gate(s) to issue (gate keys from registry, repeatable)

release.description: Release an issue from its assignee (for timeout recovery)

breakdown.description: Break down an issue into subtasks with automatic dependency inheritance Break down an issue into subtasks

args.name: parent_id
args.description: Parent issue ID to break down

flags.name: child-type
flags.description: Type for child issues (e.g., 'task', 'story', 'bug') Must match a type: label value from your hierarchy

flags.name: description
flags.description: Subtask descriptions (optional, must match number of subtasks)

flags.name: gate-preset
flags.description: Apply gate preset to all subtasks

flags.name: inherit-gates
flags.description: Inherit parent's gates to all subtasks

flags.name: json
flags.description: Output as JSON for machine consumption

claim-next.description: Claim the next available ready issue

flags.name: gate
flags.description: Gate keys from registry to require (e.g., 'tests', 'code-review'). Gates are quality checkpoints that must pass before issue completion. Use comma-separated (--gate tests,clippy) or multiple flags (--gate tests --gate clippy). Gates must be defined in registry first with 'jit gate define'

flags.name: orphan
flags.description: Explicitly allow orphaned leaf issues (tasks without parent labels)

acquire.description: Acquire a lease on an issue

flags.name: ttl
flags.description: Time-to-live in seconds (0 for indefinite, requires --reason)

flags.name: agent-id
flags.description: Agent identifier (defaults to current agent from config)

heartbeat.description: Send heartbeat for an indefinite lease

flags.name: reason
flags.description: Reason for eviction (required for audit trail)

flags.name: extension
flags.description: How many seconds to extend the lease by

closed.description: Query closed issues (Done or Rejected states)

flags.description: Filter by label pattern (exact match or wildcard)

flags.description: Return full issue objects instead of minimal summaries

Minimal issue representation for efficient list queries

Work complete, awaiting quality gate approval
